GUI

This module manages the project dungeon_gui

class GUI.GUI(problem, result, rooms)

Bases: object

This class manages the project GUI

run()

Run the GUI

GUI.enter_room(player, screen, room, hud)

Updates room rendering when player enters the room

Parameters:

  • player (Player) – Player object

  • screen (pygame Surface) – Screen where dungeon_gui runs

  • room (Room) – Room the player is entering

  • hud (HUD) – HUD object

GUI.exit_room(player, screen, room, hud)

Updates room rendering when player leaves room

Parameters:

  • player (Player) – Player object

  • screen (pygame Surface) – Screen where dungeon_gui runs

  • room (Room) – Room the player is exiting

  • hud (HUD) – HUD object

GUI.fluent_to_int(state, fluent)

Converts unified_planning Fluent to int

Parameters:

  • state (unified_planning.shortcuts.State) – Object representing the state of the problem

  • fluent (unified_planning.shortcuts.FluentExp) – Object representing a fluent

Returns:

The value of the fluent as an integer

Return type:

int

GUI.update_hud(hud, state, hero_loot, key_counter, potion_counter, actual_room_id, action, defeated_enemy_counter=None, is_exit=False)

Updates all hud variables

Parameters:

  • hud (HUD) – HUD object

  • state (unified_planning.shortcuts.State) – Object representing the state of the problem

  • hero_loot (unified_planning.shortcuts.FluentExp) – Object representing the hero loot fluent

  • key_counter (unified_planning.shortcuts.FluentExp) – Object representing the key counter fluent

  • potion_counter (unified_planning.shortcuts.FluentExp) – Object representing the potion counter fluent

  • actual_room_id (int) – The id of the actual room

  • action (str) – The last action executed

  • defeated_enemy_counter (unified_planning.shortcuts.FluentExp) – Object representing the defeated enemy counter fluent

  • is_exit (bool) – Flag to check if the actual room is the exit room
